intro: Sisymbrium richardsonii, commonly known as the Richardson's mustards, is an annual flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known mustard plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its seeds are enclosed in slender, pod-like structures. Sisymbrium richardsonii is characterized by its hairy stems and pinnately lobed leaves.
